trans-unit.source: Provides cookie integrity using an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSA"></xref> signature.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform> adds an RSA MAC to the cookie data.
This provides integrity but not confidentiality.
By default, the MAC uses SHA-256, but SHA-1 may be requested.
Cookies protected with this transform may be read by any computer that shares the same RSA private key (generally associated with an X509 certificate).
When using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform> with a service, if a key provided by a certificate changes the service must be restarted.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform"></xref> class by using the specified RSA key.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.SigningKey%2A> property is initialized to `key`.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.VerificationKeys%2A> property is initialized to a collection that contains `key` as its only element.
The RSA key to use as the default signing and verification key.
key is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform"></xref> class by using the private key of the specified certificate.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.SigningKey%2A> property is initialized to private key of the certificate.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.VerificationKeys%2A> property is initialized to a collection that contains the private key of the certificate as its only element.
The certificate whose private key is to be used for signing and verifying.
certificate is `null`.
certificate has no private key
-or-
The private key of the certificate is not an RSA key.
Verifies the specified signature and returns the original, unsigned data.
All of the keys in the collection specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.VerificationKeys%2A> property are tried.
Data previously returned from the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.Encode(System.Byte[])"></xref> method.
The original data (unsigned).
encoded is `null`.
encoded contains zero bytes.
The signature is not valid.
The data is in the wrong format.
There are no verification keys.
The platform does not support the specified algorithm.
Signs the specified data.
The key specified by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.SigningKey%2A> property must include the private key in order to sign the data.
The signed data may be verified by calling the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.Decode%2A> method.
The data to be signed.
The signed data.
value is `null`.
value contains zero bytes.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.SigningKey"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The key specified by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.SigningKey"></xref> property is not assignable as <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSACryptoServiceProvider"></xref>.
-or-
The key specified by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.SigningKey"></xref> property does not contain a private key.
The operating system does not support the specified algorithm.
Gets or sets the name of the hash algorithm to use.
SHA256 is the default algorithm.
This may require a minimum operating system of [!INCLUDE[winxpsvr](~/includes/winxpsvr-md.md)] and .NET 3.5 SP1.
If SHA256 is not supported, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.RsaSignatureCookieTransform.HashName%2A> property to "SHA1".
The name of the hash algorithm.
The default is "SHA256".
Gets or sets the RSA key that is used for signing.
The RSA key that is used for signing.
Gets the collection of keys used for signature verification.
By default, this property returns a list that contains only the signing key.
The collection of keys used for signature verification.
